concise_definition: adv. 遗憾地, 悲伤地, 不幸地

definitions.explanation_en: In a manner that expresses sorrow, regret, or disappointment; used to convey that something unfortunate or unpleasant has occurred.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以表达悲伤、遗憾或失望的方式，用于说明某件不幸或不愉快的事情发生了。
definitions.example_en: Sadly, the meeting had to be canceled due to the storm.
definitions.example_cn: 遗憾的是，由于风暴，会议不得不取消。

definitions.explanation_en: Used to introduce a contrast or an outcome that is contrary to what was hoped or expected, often with a tone of resignation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用于引出与期望相反的结果，常带有无奈或认命的语气。
definitions.example_en: She worked hard all year; sadly, she didn't get the promotion.
definitions.example_cn: 她全年努力工作，可惜却没有获得晋升。

definitions.explanation_en: To describe an action or situation that is carried out with emotional heaviness or melancholy.
definitions.explanation_cn: 描述一种带有情感沉重或忧郁色彩的行为或情境。
definitions.example_en: He sadly waved goodbye as the train pulled away.
definitions.example_cn: 火车开走时，他悲伤地挥了挥手。

comparison.analysis: “Unfortunately” (不幸地) 更侧重于客观陈述一个不理想的结果，语气中性、正式，常用于书面语或商务语境。而 “sadly” 更强调说话者的情感反应，带有主观的悲伤或惋惜情绪，语感更个人化。
“Regrettably” (令人遗憾地) 比 “sadly” 更正式，常用于官方声明或道歉语境，强调责任或过错带来的遗憾。它较少表达情绪，而更强调事态的可避免性。相比之下，“sadly” 更贴近日常情感表达。
“Gloomily” (忧郁地) 描述的是情绪状态的持续性阴郁，常用于描绘人物的表情、语气或环境氛围，如 “He spoke gloomily about the future”。而 “sadly” 更常用于修饰整个事件或结果，强调事件本身的令人难过，而非情绪的持续表现。
